RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 56. Maiden Claiming Purse 16600. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SHEWEARSSTILETTOS kept the edge from the start, drew clear at the five sixteenths pole and raced at the rail on the turn, was only mildly asked into the lane then taken in hand the final sixteenth. UNALTERED gave chase, raced in the four path on the turn and settled for second. S S FOUR QUEENS chased through the backstretch, raced in the five path on the turn and came along for third later yards. RUMORGOINGAROUND chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn at the rail and finished evenly to pass rivals. PLAYING FOR TWO pressured the pace but dropped back at the five sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the turn and weakened in the lane. SWISS HORIZON gave chase, raced at the rail on the turn and weakened in the lane. STORMI VANNA gave chase, rounded the turn about the five path and showed little in the lane. This race was hand timed.

ENTRY.NAME: Shewearsstilettos
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W
ENTRY.COMMENT: kept edge from start,clear 5/16,widened rail turn,in hand 1/16

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 71. Claiming Purse 11300. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races At A Mile Or Over Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibi lity).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SPIRIT OF WINDSOR took over and moved to the inside to rate the pace, was met a the nine sixteenths pole and turned back Strong Heart toward the three eighths, dug in to the challenge of MUD BUG shortly afterward and recovered the advantage approaching the quarter pole, raced clear nearing the head of the lane and was steadily handled in the lane. The latter saved ground off the pace then eased out with a bid leaving the half mile pole, challenged the winner and took a brief lead nearing the three eighths pole, but was caught approaching the quarter, dropped back into the lane and finished evenly. TYRY TYRANNOSAURUS rounded the first turn about the three path then saved ground on the second turn, picked up the chase toward the seven sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and ran evenly in the lane. MASTER THIS rounded the first turn five wide and the second turn about the four path, gave chase into the backstretch, came through the far turn in the three path then flattened stride. DEVIL'S CANYON rounded the opening turn about the four path, picked up the chase from the five eighths pole but showed little response through the backstretch. STRONG HEART raced six wide on the first turn, closed to contention and stalked two deep on the second turn and raced at even terms at the nine sixteenths pole, gave chase from that point but weakened approaching the far turn. SPECTACULO stalked early from the two and three paths but was distanced after a half mile.

ENTRY.NAME: Mud Bug
ENTRY.OWNER: Prostar 10 Stables Inc and The Four Horsemen Racing Stable Inc

ENTRY.NAME: Spirit of Windsor
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,met 9/16,dueled from 3/8,steady urging lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 66. Maiden Claiming Purse 17100. FOR MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GAMMA SQUEEZE closed to contention and stalked from the two and three paths, challenged leaving the second turn and dueled at mostly even terms from that point, contested the edge off the rail on the far turn, drew clear past the eighth pole and held well with steady handling. ICETECA settled back in the two and three paths and left the second turn outside, bid past the three eighths pole, raced in range of the lead in the four path on the far turn and dueled through later yards for second. CURTEIS settled in the four path then stalked three wide leaving the second turn, gave chase approaching the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail then outfinished in a later duel for second. ONLY GET'N BETTER saved ground, picked up the chase approaching the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail but weakened in the lane. REMASTERED rated a slim lead inside, dug in to the challenge of Gamma Squeeze leaving the half mile pole and dueled from that point, was met past the seven sixteenths, dropped back at the rail leaving the eighth pole and weakened in the lane. MR MAJESTIC stalked off the rail, gave chase leaving the second turn but faded through the backstretch.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 73. Allowance Purse 28400. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, OR WAIVER CLAIMING OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mil e Or Over Since July 18 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since June 18 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: REVEREND JACK settled toward the inside, started a bid nearing the three eighths pole and contested at a close disadvantage two deep on the far turn, dueled for the lead near mid-stretch and widened under steady urging later yards. REY O REYES moved to the inside and rated the pace, came under pressure approaching the three eighths pole, contested the edge at the rail on the far turn, dueled at even terms through the upper stretch but relented the final sixteenth. CHASE LIL ME saved ground racing well off the early pace, raced outside into the backstretch, bid leaving the three eighths pole and rounded the far turn about the five path, left the turn widest and came along for third inside the sixteenth pole. LEG UP settled off the pace about the three path, gave chase leaving the nine sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn in the four path then flattened later yards. HARPERSGONEFISHING stalked the pace off the rail, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole but started to faded past the quarter pole. CHESAPEAKE CHARLIE settled in the four path early on, gave chase leaving the half mile pole, rounded the far turn near the rail and showed little in the lane. DON'TCALLTOOEARLY came away awkwardly, settled off the rail and showed little response through the backstretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Harpersgonefishing
ENTRY.OWNER: Hasty Rebel Stables LLC and Carlisle Horse Company

ENTRY.NAME: Reverend Jack
ENTRY.OWNER: Hasty Rebel Stables LLC and Carlisle Horse Company

ENTRY.NAME: Rey O Reyes
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 67. Claiming Purse 15700. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 18 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, For Each $1,000 To $8,000 1 lb. (Races Where Entered Fo r $6,250 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances) NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: RUNNING FREE was hustled up and pressured the pace, raced close two deep on the turn, took the nod into the lane and dug in under steady handling to hold on well. GILDED QUEST gave chase through the backstretch, raced at the rail on the turn, was outfinished in the duel through the stretch but held on for second. IRISH VALENTINE chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the four path and finished well while gaining on the runner-up. TWO STEP SALLY chased inside, raced off the rail on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. DAPPLESANDDIAMONDS chased inside, entered the turn at the rail but angled to the outside leaving the turn and finished evenly. ICY STARE took a quick lead and angled to the inside to set a pressured pace, contested the advantage at the rail on the turn, was met into the lane and relented the final sixteenth. FESSIN UP saved ground.

ENTRY.NAME: Gilded Quest
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Ronney W and Richie Rich Racing Stable

ENTRY.NAME: Running Free
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled to contention,close 2d turn,nod 1/8,held well driving

ENTRY.NAME: Icy Stare
ENTRY.OWNER: Pesaturo Gus and Joy Kevin J
ENTRY.COMMENT: quick lead,set pressured pace,edge rail turn,met 1/8,relent 1/16

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 67. Claiming Purse 10800. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 18 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BUBBA G pressured the pace and took the nod approaching the three eighths pole, contested at a close disadvantage three wide through the turn, drifted into the lane but dug in determinedly to regain control and edged out DIVINING DANCER through later yards. The latter pressured the pace and dueled for the nod two deep approaching the head of the lane, but was met in later yards and reluctantly ceded. TRAPPE THE GOLD chased outside, rounded the turn about the seven path and dug in to take third the final stride. ATLANTIC VAQUERO pressured the pace inside, contested with the advantage nearest the rail on the turn, was met toward the head of the lane and continued close to late stretch before flattening stride. THE CLOWN pressured the early pace outside, raced in the six path on the turn then flattened the final sixteenth. PERSONAL FINANCE pressured the pace through the backstretch, dropped back at the quarter pole, raced off the rail on the turn then flattened in the lane. HAGGERSDALE gave chase, raced in the four and five paths on the turn and showed little in the lane. UNCLE REMI set the early pace inside, was met approaching the three eighths pole, dropped back toward the five sixteenths and weakened at the rail on the turn. BOSEY saved ground.

ENTRY.NAME: Uncle Remi
ENTRY.COMMENT: early lead inside,met 3/8,dropped back 5/16,weakened rail turn

ENTRY.NAME: Atlantic Vaquero
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed inside,edge rail turn,met near 1/8,flattened late yards

ENTRY.NAME: Bubba G
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace,nod near 3/8,close 3wd turn,determined stretch duel

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Lantern Hill Farm LLC & Lighthouse Group LLC

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 7F Dirt CR: 92. Starter Allowance Purse 18600. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $5,000 OR LESS SINCE AUGUST 18, 2021. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 18 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since June 18 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $8,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: JAYJAYDEE moved to the inside and raced with the early pace then stalked into the first turn, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, took the nod past the three eighths, raced clear toward the quarter and was steadily handled in the lane. NEVER COMPROMISE raced off the pace two deep on the first turn, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn in the three path then dueled through the stretch for second. RIDICULOUS saved ground just off the pace, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail and was outfinished in the stretch duel for second. UNCAPTURED KING saved ground off the pace, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, lacked room at the rail approaching the head of the lane, checked and altered course mid-stretch but came back to finish evenly. HAGLER settled in the three and four paths the first turn, left the turn outside and picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the four path and ran evenly in the lane. MISSIONSNINETYNINE raced with the early pace then took over and rated on the lead from the five eighths pole, came under pressure at the seven sixteenths pole, gave up the lead at the three eighths and faded off the rail on the far turn. FEARNOUGHT settled two deep on the first turn then faded through the backstretch.

ENTRY.NAME: Uncaptured King
ENTRY.OWNER: Murdock Stephen and Marceda John A

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 73. Claiming Purse 13700. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE FEBRUARY 18, 2023 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Since February 18 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BLACK PANDA took the lead on the chute and set a pressured pace inside, raced at the rail on the turn and held on well under steady stretch handling. INCLUDE THE BEAST engaged in close chase through the backstretch, raced in the three path on the turn then dueled through the stretch for second. THUNDER PUNCH came away awkwardly but was hustled up to press the pace inside, raced at the rail on the turn then outfinished in the stretch duel for second. QUEEN CASHMERE chased inside, raced at the rail on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. SOMMER VELVET gave chase, rounded the turn about the three path and showed little in the lane. CAPTAIN SAM chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn in the five path and showed little in the lane. KOBE'S GIRL lacked speed while racing outside.

ENTRY.NAME: Black Panda
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,rail turn,held well driving
